reviews.text: I've just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam. We stayed in the Avenue hotel on Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal right in the centre of town. It's a five minute walk from Centraal Station and between 10-30 minutes walk to virtually anywhere in the city. In fact we didn't travel on the trams/metro once as everything was so close by!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location!

reviews.text: We went to over there to shop and the two main shopping streets Kalverstraat and Nieuwendijk are literally round the corner. Fantastic!
reviews.title: Shamelesness

reviews.text: The hotel is on a busy street but we had a room facing the courtyard (number 305) so it was quiet. Double glazing as well. The room was functional and clean. We didn't have a bath but the water was hot and the shower good. The towels were nice. The room wasn't big but then again we only slept in there so we didn't need a lot of space. There were the beds, a table and two chairs, a full lenght mirror and a TV. The TV had all the usual suspects, BBC News 24, BBC Prime, CNN, plus local Dutch and German channels.
reviews.title: Overpriced and dreary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were ever so friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is really really good, fantastic choice of breads, meats, cheese, fruit, cereals and hot breakfast like sausages and bacon. Plus coffee, tea and fruitjuices. I've stayd in Lisbon (****) and Vienna (***) lately and this buffet beats both hands down.
reviews.title: Good location
great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is quite safe as well as you need the room keycard to get into the lift from reception and the breakfast room. Plus there is someone in reception 24/7.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Avenue for 2 nights. The room was rather small but with a good size bathroom. Very dark as very little natural light and no main light in the room. Bed was very comfy. The hotel was in a great location a few minutes walk from the Centraal Station. most things in walking distance. Receptionists were very aloof and quite unfriendly. I would imagine them to be very at home in a 5 star ultra luxury hotel, as they walked around with their noses in the air! All in all a good stay and the breakfast was OK too.
reviews.title: excellent location, a little dreary
very noisy in the front
reviews.text: I wish I had paid more attention to the reviews, and had asked for a room at the back. When we got there, the hotel was full and the room we were given was overlooking the street, and super noisy. Despite the noise and mosquitoes, closing the window was not an option, since there is no air conditioning.
And the breakfast--eh. If you want to eat piles of cheese and cold cuts, it would be okay. I would have preferred more breads and pastries.
reviews.title: The Avenue Hotel---Great as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was our 3rd stay at the Avenue, it was great to see that nothing has changed. The rooms are very nice, and roomy. As always, the breah\kfast is truely exceptional. So much to offer ! Location is very good for most of what Amsterdam has to offer. Again, the staff is very helpful. Some of the same staff have worked there for years, and I recognized them from a last visit.
reviews.title: fab rooms, ace location, smashing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well what can I say , it had been many years since I had visited
reviews.title: fab location
A Break from the Kids
reviews.text: October 13th, our 2nd weekend away from the kids in 11 years. On the whole NOT BAD! Enjoyed Amsterdam.

reviews.title: As european hotels go.....a little gem
reviews.text: Stayed at The Avenue Hotel, great location, walking distance to Central Station. Not too noisy, except for the bell chimes every hour with a rendition of "Onward Christian Soldiers". Hotel a bit quirky, but staff friendly and helpful, though no plug in bathroom sink, why? don't know, and shower not very good. Rooms are quite small but adequate. All you can eat for breakfast if you really want it after a hangover, fry ups, traditional cheeses, hams, rolls, fruit etc., Sent boyfriend down to bar for refreshments but bar closes at midnight. If you are into smoking it's a paradise for you, offered to you constantly, and the sex scene is certainly an eye opener. The live shows and cinemas are more of a laugh than anything, but do go with an open mind.

reviews.title: VERY NOISY AND NO AIRCON!!!!!!
reviews.text: Lin, Solihull

reviews.title: Fine for what we needed.
reviews.text: Having booked this hotel priopr to reading any reviews, was a little bit anxious. So much so we specifically requested a quiet room on the upper floors which they kindly arranged. If you go to city hotels in europe common sence dictates that unless you are willing to pay big money, basically you get what you pay for. However, we found the Avenue to be clean, friendly, great location, excellent breakfast as much as you can eat which really sets you up for the day. The atmosphere was relaxed and friendly as were the staff. Yes the rooms were on the small size, but fully equiped. On the main it was no more noisey than any other holiday hotel. Guide me to a holiday hotel where you cannot hear late night revelers returning from a night out! The location was great for all the things that has to been seen and close enough to call back in in the afternoon for a quick refresh and rest. The hotel would benefit from tea and coffee making facilities but as seasoned travelers we never travel without our travel kettle! Easy location to get to from the station, so much so when we asked for a taxi, we were advised that we would be wasting our money! There were roadworks outside and no trams were running along the front of the hotel, which would no doubt add to background noise, but hey, it is a city hotel, in the heart of Amsterdam. If you want peace and quiet go to the country. Would I use it again, yes. It reflected value for money the clientiel were mixed. When we stayed there were no children staying or none that we seen.

reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, and convenient!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Avenue Hotel from 17th to 21st July 2006 in a triple room and i must say i was a little disapointed at the overall hotel. We were put into a tiny room for 3 people right on the front street.....big mistake...VERY noisy....trams sound like they are coming through the room...like a mini eathquake every 5 mins and loads of noise from passing tourists all hours, the foldy out bed was broken in the room aswell. We asked to be moved next day and the staff were a bit off as they said that's what you should expect and it's only to 1am for the trams and they start back at 6am...so 5hours will do anyone wont it...lol. The new room was at the side of hotel (put us in a double superior which was larger than the triple) and was like stoner alley at night....more noise from stoners. Then there was the heat in the Rooms RED hot we had to sleep with wet towels on us to cool down, no air con apart from breakfast room.
We stayed there for 4 nights in April.
reviews.title: Great location but very noisy and poor room lighting

reviews.text: The first room we were given was below street level with the windows just above the pavement. We asked to be relocated higher up and were offered a twin room.
reviews.title: Loud Tram Noise
Nice hotel, good location close to train station
reviews.text: Good Points:
- Great Location from the train station/Dam Square etc
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: - Great Breakfast - really good value.
reviews.title: Its warm inside
Bad expeience
reviews.text: The location of the Hotel was good, it was close to the central station and the breakfast was good and there was plenty of food. With that in mind I would never stay at this hotel again. The beds and pillows were miserably uncomfortable and the front desk staff tried to overcharge us when we checked in and then tried to say that we didn't pay for the room as we were checking out. The staff finally beleived us when we showed them a payment receipt. There were a lot of other hotels that were nicer in the same location and for a cheaper price.

My boyfriend and i are just back from a freezing but brillant weekend in Amsterdam. Having stayed at the Avenue hotel before we didn't hesitate to go back there. We have found on both occasions the staff to be very friendly and the rooms spotless. The breakfast was also good. If your looking to chill like the locals we recommend Bens coffeeshop just past the hotel, first street on the left.
reviews.title: Sweet!!!
Great Deal in Amsterdam
reviews.text: The rooms are small but the location and price cannot be beat. The staff was friendly and plenty of food on the buffet.

I was quite pleased with this hotel. Excellent location, walking distance to almost everything. We had a quad room with a good amount of space. 2 beds were in a loft upstairs, and with the windows and the loft you could really experience some of Amsterdam's unique architecture. I found good prices on the internet, but when I e-mailed the hotel with some questions, they beat the lowest internet price, saving me 90 euros a night from the original rate I found! The breakfast was good and easy. I felt the hotel was very safe and secure. Parking was easy in the lot underneath, costing 35 euros a day. I'll definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Very Happy

reviews.text: We really enjoyed this hotel. Excellent hot buffet breakfast. Friendly & helpful staff. We stayed here twice, once in a double and once in a triple...both rooms were very large - the double had a bed and a futon, and the triple had a gorgeous bathroom. great location.
reviews.title: amazing stay!

reviews.text: Avenue Hotel is in a great location and the lobby looks very nice. The staff is extremely rude if you want to ask them a question. They act like you are bothering them. The room have a very small bathroom and NO air conditioner. If you go in the summer, you should ask for a fan at the front desk. I have been to Amsterdam on several times, but I will never stay at the Avenue Hotel again!
reviews.title: Nice location, staff not nice.

likes.disliked: — The front desk staff were very rude.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is a little dated- i stayed at the Avenue Hotel in April of 2005...
reviews.title: Love the Avenue- great bargain, great location

reviews.text: After a long search for the right hotel, I decided to book the Avenue Hotel for a 5 night stay in Amsterdam. I have been to the city previously, but stayed in a hotel far outside the central district. This time around i was looking to be closer to the action.
reviews.title: Well-run Hotel near Everything

likes.disliked: — Didn't find location noisy, but it could be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here as a lay over on our way home. The avenue is about a ten minute walk from the station and allowed us to leave our luggage all day so that we could go round the city long before we could check in. It is within 5 minutes of Dam square and really well placed on one of the main tram routes. The rooms were small but clean and all of the staff really friendly. bar prices were very reasonable for a hotel.
reviews.title: City Convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We Stayed in this hotel 4 years ago and enjoyed our stay. Because the location was good we thought we would try it again, and were happy to see the same standard was there, very good value for a 3 star.The rooms are very clean and the bathroom spotless, beds were comfy we both slept well. The staff are helpful and courteous
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.text: and the food at breakfast was to a good standard and plentiful. If you are coming to Amsterdam for a short break we would definitely recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: - Great location..can walk straight from centraal station to hotel.
reviews.title: Hate it afterall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (my wife and I) wanted somewhere to stay for 4 days for my 60th birthday. The Avenue was recommended by a local travel agent, so I checked out the comments on Tripadvisor then returned and booked it.
reviews.title: Very happy here

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly, polite and helpful with queries and questions. The Hotel is owned by a group which has other Amsterdam Hotels also and whilst there is no restaurant on site, a complimentary ticket for one in one of their other nearby hotels (2 minutes walk towards the Railway Station away), giving a ten percent discount on meals, is part of the welcome pack in the rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: There is a bar on site open 5pm to midnight daily where we were able to buy Bombay Sapphire gin and bottles of tonic, a double cost 10 Euros (for her indoors, who didn't want to try the local gin - Jenever). Pizzas can be ordered in the bar but as the streets all around are brimming with cafes, take aways, restaurants etc, we didn't try this service. I settled for a "medium" glass of Heineken at 2.50 Euros!
reviews.title: Clean, well located, well priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My travel agent told us that only "Continental" breakfasts were served in the hotel. Continental breakfasts have changed since I was a lad! This used to mean a croissant and a cup of coffee but breakfast catered for all nationalities with a help yourself choice of: 4 cereals, fruits in syrup, a great bowl of yoghurt, croissants, hard boiled eggs, hot scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, frankfurter sausages, tomatoes, a choice of salads and cold meats, grapefruit juice, orange juice, cold milk, piping hot coffee, hot milk, tea, marmalades, jams, bread rolls etc etc. We ate until full and didn't need to eat again until evening, and we used up a lot of energy walking all over the city! There is enough food at breakfast to make up packed lunches if you so desired without denting the constantly re-filled dish quantities.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative I could give was that one of the two showers (yes, TWO) over the bath was badly set so her indoors flooded the bathroom floor in spite of having pulled the curtain round as far as possible, (AND tucked it inside the bath) and soaked the floor towel rather extensively!
reviews.title: excellent hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit apprehensive as we arrived at the Avenue last week, after reading some of the reviews, but we needn't have worried. I'd asked for a quieter back room, which we were allocated. Our room was spotless and larger than a lot of others that I've stayed in. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff polite. The location of the hotel was spot on, only a couple of minutes walk from the railway station. We walked everywhere (the fantastic weather allowed us to wander). We would definately use this one again.
reviews.title: Avenue Hotel, Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After booking this hotel before reading other reviews we were a little apprehensive but need not have been! This is a lovely hotel for a weekend break. You can walk to anywhere in old Amsterdam from this hotel, but it is not in the noisiest/busiest of areas.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel. It was compact but had all we needed (especially as we took our travel kettle!). The bathroom (about which we had heard so much!!) is a wet room - perfectly acceptable in modern hotels and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Avenue Hotel, Amsterdam

reviews.text: Safety deposit boxes can be hired in the lobby for 2.50 euros per day. Breakfast is plentiful and varied.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Great girls holiday!
reviews.text: We'd certainly recommend it to others.

reviews.title: Gary's 40th birthday
reviews.text: I took my hubby for his 40th Birthday,

reviews.title: 5 nights at the Avenue
reviews.text: dont think he will forget his 40th after what happened.

reviews.title: Noisy and sleep disturbed
reviews.text: just watch your bag ladies and gentlemen keep your hand in your pocket on your money....petty theifs are very clever..but not clever enough for us....

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: Was very nice hotel,clean but found the room was bit on the small side, the toilet felt loose and we were scared to put any weight on it incase it fell of the wall.

reviews.title: Better than we expected
reviews.text: had amugging on the streets of amsterdam hotel receptionist was very good,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. It is only a 5 minute walk from centraal train station and is right in the centre of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: great location, great value, would go back

likes.disliked: — no tea and coffee in rooms

reviews.text: Our check in was very quick and efficient and the reception staff were courrteous and helpful throughout the stay.
reviews.title: Perfect spot in the heart of Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great for a short break, it is spotlessly clean and the rooms are modern and comfortable.
reviews.title: Quality hotel for a good price

reviews.text: We paid about £75 per night and i think this was quite good value for bed and breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's difficult to get cheap beds in Amsterdam, so this was fine.
reviews.title: We would not return

likes.disliked: — Flooding bathroom at best unhygienic at worst dangerous
